data.Title: Google August 2024 Core Update: Gains Reversing, Impacts AI Overviews
data.Description: Google's August 2024 core update, released on August 15th, is showing signs of volatility with some sites experiencing a reversal of initial gains. Additionally, the update appears to be impacting Google's AI Overviews, with sites seeing ranking fluctuations in this feature alongside broader core update effects. Google advises waiting until the update is fully rolled out before assessing its full impact.

data.Title: Google Search Ranking Bug Resolved
data.Description: A Google Search ranking bug that surfaced around the same time as the August core update has been resolved after more than four days. The bug's impact and its relation to the core update are still being analyzed.

data.Title: Google Tests Blue Verification Icons in Organic Search Results
data.Description: Google is experimenting with blue verification icons within its free organic search results. The move aims to enhance trust and authenticity for users.

data.Title: Unanswered Comments Don't Impact Google Search Rankings
data.Description: Google's Martin Splitt has confirmed that having unanswered comments on a website does not negatively affect its search engine rankings. Google Search does not consider whether comments receive responses as a ranking factor.

data.Title: Google Ads Bug Misattributes Traffic, Credits Advertisers
data.Description: A bug in Google Ads incorrectly attributed traffic to "smart matching," a feature that doesn't exist. Google is aware of the issue and will be crediting affected advertisers.

data.Title: Perplexity AI Search Engine to Introduce Ads in Q4
data.Description: AI-powered search engine Perplexity has revealed plans to launch ads in the fourth quarter of 2024. The platform intends to use a cost-per-thousand impressions (CPM) model with prices exceeding $50, and will allow advertisers to sponsor "related questions."

data.Title: Microsoft to Release 'Recall' AI Search Feature to Testers
data.Description: Microsoft will release its controversial "Recall" AI search feature to testers in October. Recall captures screenshots of on-screen activity, enabling users to search for previously viewed information.

data.Title: Google Introduces 'Google-CloudVertexBot' Crawler for Vertex AI
data.Description: Google has launched a new web crawler, "Google-CloudVertexBot," designed to crawl websites at the request of site owners for building Vertex AI Agents.

data.Title: Meta Launches New Web Crawler for AI Model Data Collection
data.Description: Meta has deployed a new web crawler to gather more data from the open web, aiming to enhance its AI models. The move has sparked discussions about data privacy and website owner control over data scraping.

data.Title: Condé Nast Partners with OpenAI for Content Integration
data.Description: Condé Nast has signed a multiyear agreement with OpenAI, granting ChatGPT and SearchGPT access to surface stories from renowned publications like The New Yorker, Vogue, Vanity Fair, Bon Appetit, and Wired.

data.Title: Google Updates Maps Design in Search Results
data.Description: Google has refreshed the design of its maps displayed within search results, including local packs and knowledge panel maps.

data.Title: Bing Image Search Introduces Refinement Cards
data.Description: Bing Image Search now features refinement cards directly within its results interface. These cards provide users with refinement options for their queries, accompanied by example photos for potential refined searches.

data.Title: Google Search Console Data Persists After Domain Expiration
data.Description: Google has clarified that Search Console data remains accessible even after a domain expires. There is currently no option to reset this data, although temporarily removing the site from Search Console can hide it.

data.Title: Google Analytics Experiences Data Outage, Real-Time Unaffected
data.Description: Google Analytics encountered a temporary data outage, with historical data unavailable while real-time data remained functional. The issue has since been resolved.

data.Title: Google to Migrate All Merchants to Google Merchant Center Next
data.Description: Google will be transitioning all merchants to its new Google Merchant Center Next platform in September 2024.
